shots_table¶

class tracktor_server.shots_table.Shots(db_name)¶

Bases: object

Class to manage connection to the backend Shots table.

This class provides methods to to write/read from a SQLite database directly, while main.py handles the requests and calls on these functions.

db_name¶

The name of the SQLite database file.

Type:

str

connection¶

The database connection.

Type:

sqlite3.Connection or None

add_shot_for_project(project_id, shot_name)¶

Adds a single shot with a custom name to the project.

Parameters:

  • project_id (int) – The ID of the project.

  • shot_name (str) – The name of the shot.

Returns:

The ID of the newly created shot.

Return type:

int

add_shots_for_project(project_id, shotsNum)¶

Sends off a loop that creates a requested number of shots.

Parameters:

  • project_id (int) – The ID of the project.

  • shotsNum (int) – Number of shots to create.

change_shot_status(shot_id, status_item, new_status)¶

Changes the status of any dropdown status item, aka LAY, ANI, etc.

Parameters:

  • shot_id (int) – The ID of the shot.

  • status_item (str) – The status column to update (e.g., ‘lay_status’).

  • new_status (str) – The new status value.

get_all_shots()¶

Get all columns of one shot from one project

Returns:

A list of all shot rows.

Return type:

list[sqlite3.Row]

get_db()¶

Opens the named database or creates one if it doesn’t exist.

Returns:

The db connection object.

Return type:

sqlite3.Connection

get_shot_from_project(project_id, shot_id)¶

Get all columns of one shot from one project.

Parameters:

  • project_id (int) – The ID of the project.

  • shot_id (int) – The ID of the shot.

Returns:

The shot row, or None if not found.

Return type:

sqlite3.Row

get_shots_from_project(project_id)¶

Get shots to display on the project page

Parameters:

project_id (int) – The ID of the project.

Returns:

A list of shot rows for the project.

Return type:

list[sqlite3.Row]

init_shots_table()¶

Creates and SQL table for shots if it doesn’t already exist.

remove_shot_from_project(shot_id)¶

Deletes a specific shot from the database.

Parameters:

shot_id (int) – The ID of the shot to remove.

remove_shots_from_project(project_id)¶

Removes all shots from the specified project.

Parameters:

project_id (int) – The ID of the project.
